citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
2.33 b (3)
During this inspection, records were reviewed including an animal welfare concern and incident report reviewed by the
IACUC for pig #58450 under protocol 268-00-20-R that was found dead at approximately 7:30 am on 7 October 2022.
The daily observation of pig #58450, conducted by animal care staff and the co-investigator on 6 October 2022 between
10:17 and 11:00 am, noted on the health record that the pig was experiencing clinical signs of experimental disease
including severe lameness, frequent laying down and lesions present. Pig #58450 was given a clinical score (CS) of 4. As
per protocol and as stated in the email to the researchers, animal care staff reentered the room between 12:00 and 12:45
pm to administer treatments, where it was noted on the medical record that pig #58450 was experiencing cyanosis around
the snout and little interest in food, indicating a further decline in health. Per protocol and animal care standard operating
procedures, any animals experiencing a CS of 4 or more shall be reported to the attending veterinarian. The research
facility was unable to clearly demonstrate that their staff followed the protocol and animal care standard operating
procedures on whether the attending veterinarian was notified after the first and second observations of pig #58540. They
were also unable to clearly demonstrate when the notifications took place and if euthanasia was authorized by the
attending veterinarian. After reviewing the incident report and speaking with facility researchers and animal care staff,
inspectors found conflicting information on whether research staff had a reluctance for approved humane euthanasia of
the pig based on how they understood the protocol. The research facility was unable to demonstrate that their mechanism
of direct and frequent communication required to relay timely and accurate information on problems of animal health,
behavior, and well-being was conveyed to the attending veterinarian. This resulted in a delay in the timely treatment
and/or humane euthanasia of pig #58450 as outlined in the protocol. The research facility must establish and maintain a
mechanism of direct and frequent communication so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health,
behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian to ensure that research studies involving animals will
avoid or minimize discomfort, distress, and pain to the animals. Correct by: 11 August 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
End of report.
Additional Inspectors:
DAWN BARKSDALE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
